output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a solid foundation in Business Intelligence principles and techniques. You are now equipped to contribute to data-driven decision-making within your organization.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Intermediate Business Intelligence course! This course builds upon foundational BI knowledge, diving deeper into advanced techniques and tools for data analysis, visualization, and reporting. We'll explore real-world scenarios and practical applications to enhance your BI skillset.

chapters.description: Review of data warehousing concepts: schemas (star, snowflake), ETL processes, and the importance of data quality. Focus on dimensional modeling techniques.
Mastering advanced SQL queries for data aggregation, window functions, and performance optimization. Using SQL for data transformation and reporting.
Exploring different data integration approaches: real-time vs. batch processing, data virtualization, and cloud-based data integration solutions.
Principles of effective data visualization: choosing the right chart type, color palettes, and storytelling with data. Avoiding common visualization pitfalls.
Designing interactive and insightful dashboards: incorporating key performance indicators (KPIs), user experience (UX) considerations, and mobile optimization.
Crafting compelling narratives with data: using visuals, annotations, and context to communicate insights effectively to stakeholders.
Overview of data mining techniques: classification, clustering, regression, and association rule mining. Understanding the applications of data mining in business.
Building predictive models using statistical techniques: linear regression, logistic regression, and time series analysis. Evaluating model performance and accuracy.
Exploring emerging trends in BI: artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), natural language processing (NLP), and the impact of these technologies on the future of BI.

modules.moduleTitle: Data Mining and Future Trends in BI
